isis.stitle: FAN DRIVE CLUTCH: HORTON ON/OFF - FAN CLUTCH "SYSTEM SENTRY"™ - "SYSTEM SENTRY" RELEASE

svcproc.title: "SYSTEM SENTRY" RELEASE
svcproc.para: The "System Sentry" feature improves the long-term durability of the on/off fan clutch. If low air pressure occurs for any reason in the system, the piston friction disc will begin to slip. The friction of this slippage will create heat which will cause the "System Sentry" to react, releasing the clutch to prevent damage. The "System Sentry" is fitted to the piston friction disc in a 1/8 inch, left-hand thread pipe plug ( Figure 4). DO NOT ATTEMPT TO REPLACE THE "SYSTEM SENTRY" WITH A NORMAL PIPE PLUG. THIS WILL CAUSE THE CLUTCH TO BE OUT OF BALANCE, CREATING FURTHER ADVERSE CONDITIONS.
The "System Sentry" must be replaced after it has released the clutch.

A "System Sentry" clutch release is detectable when the engine is shut down because the sound of releasing air will be heard for a short time after the engine is turned off (see , TROUBLESHOOTING, section marked "System Sentry," ). The rush of air at the front of the piston friction disc is the primary indicator that the "System Sentry" has released the clutch.

warning.para: To avoid possible personal injury, do not check for this air rush or any air leak unless the ignition switch is in the OFF position and the engine is stopped.

svcproc.para:
When the "System Sentry" has released the clutch and shut down the system, the entire clutch application system must be checked for air leaks, including clutch seals and air cartridge (refer to TROUBLESHOOTING). Also the electrical control switches and solenoid valve need to be tested for proper function. Any fan obstructions must be removed, and the hub must turn freely when not engaged. THE CAUSE OF CLUTCH SLIPPAGE MUST BE DETERMINED AND REPAIRED BEFORE THE CLUTCH IS PUT BACK INTO OPERATION.
DO NOT REPLACE THE "SYSTEM SENTRY" WITHOUT DETERMINING THE CAUSE OF ITS RELEASE.As with the old fan clutch, "come home" bolts can be used to lock the clutch temporarily until repairs can be made.
